meanings.definition: Test again to check previous results.
meanings.sent1: She retested the experiment to make sure it was correct.
meanings.sent2: The teacher retested the students on their spelling words.
meanings.sent3: He retested the cake in the oven to avoid burning it.
meanings.sent4: The detective retested the evidence to uncover any mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The doctor retested the patient's blood sample for accuracy.

meanings.definition: Subject to a second examination to confirm accuracy.
meanings.sent1: The retested results showed the same outcome as before.
meanings.sent2: The retested product met the quality standards.
meanings.sent3: The retested puzzle seemed even more challenging the second time.
meanings.sent4: The retested theory proved to be true after further analysis.
meanings.sent5: The retested data provided more reliable information for the study.
